alert.note: Alert for Essex; Morris; Passaic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 11 at 11:32PM EDT until April 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Pine Brook affecting Morris, Essex, and Passaic Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Passaic River At Pine Brook. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, street flooding occurs in Fairfield including Camp Lane Road. Two Bridges Road is closed going into Lincoln Park and Wayne. At 19.5 feet, Horseneck Road in Fairfield is subject to flooding and closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 AM EDT Monday was 20.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage on Tuesday afternoon and it should continue falling to 18.2 feet on Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date Passaic River Pine Brook 19.0 19.7 Mon 11 pm 18.8 18.4 Crested &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1130 AM EDT.
